SSG_Tools.Viewers
Class JoglPanel

java.lang.Object
  SSG_Tools.Viewers.JoglPanel

public class JoglPanel
extends java.lang.Object

This class provides a GLCanvas or GLJPanel that can be used to render different objects. The constructor is given an instance of an IGL_Renderable object that will be drawn. Applications will use this class by implementing a specialized IGL_Renderable class that coordinates drawing the scene. If no camera is specified, a default perspective camera will be used. Lighting is enabled by default, but can be disabled with the method supplied. GL_LIGHT0 is used for a headlight that appears to move with the observer. GL_LIGHT0 should NOT be used for other lights in the scene graph, if the headlight is enabled. The headlight can be disabled with the method supplied.

Nested Class Summary
 class JoglPanel.Renderer
          The class Renderer provides the interface to OpenGL through jogl.

Constructor Detail

JoglPanel

public JoglPanel(IGL_Renderable scene,
                 boolean is_heavy)
This constructor constructs either a a heavy-weight GLCanvas object or a light-weight GLJPanel object, using the default capabilities. Internally, it constructs a GLEventListener that will actually do the drawing when the canvas is exposed, resized, etc.

Parameters:
scene - The scene graph that this GLCanvas object will render.
is_heavy - Flag to determine which type of GLDrawable to construct. If true a heavy-weight GLCanvas is constructed. If false a light-weight GLJPanel is constructed.

JoglPanel

public JoglPanel(IGL_Renderable scene)
This constructor constructs a heavy weight GLCanvas object using the default capabilities, and internally, constructs a GLEventListener that will actually do the drawing when the canvas is exposed, resized, etc.

Parameters:
scene - The scene graph that this GLCanvas object will render.

JoglPanel

public JoglPanel(IGL_Renderable scene,
                 boolean is_heavy,
                 int mode)
This constructor constructs either a a heavy-weight GLCanvas object or a light-weight GLJPanel object, using the default capabilities, with DEBUG_MODE or TRACE_MODE turned on. If DEBUG_MODE is turned on any error messages generated by OpenGL will be automatically printed. If TRACE_MODE is turned on, each OpenGL call will be printed.

Parameters:
scene - The scene graph that this GLCanvas object will render.
is_heavy - Flag to determine which type of GLDrawable to construct. If true a heavy-weight GLCanvas is constructed. If false a light-weight GLJPanel is constructed.
mode - Flag to determine whether trace, debug, or normal (quiet) mode will be used. One of the values: TRACE_MODE, DEBUG_MODE or NORMAL_MODE should be passed in for this paramter. Other values are ignored, and NORMAL_MODE will be used.
Method Detail

getDisplayComponent

public java.awt.Component getDisplayComponent()
Get the actual GLCanvas that this panel draws into.

Returns:
the GL_Canvas for this panel.

Draw

public void Draw()
Request that the the panel be cleared and redrawn.

isDrawing

public boolean isDrawing()
Check whether a redraw has been requested for this panel, but not yet completed.

Returns:
true if a redraw has been scheduled, but not completed for this panel, and false otherwise.

setScene

public void setScene(IGL_Renderable new_scene)
Set a new IGL_Renderable object to be drawn by this panel. Only one IGL_Renderable can be drawn by this panel. The change will not be visible until the panel is redrawn.

Parameters:
new_scene - The new IGL_Renderable that should be drawn by this panel.

getScene

public IGL_Renderable getScene()
Get a reference to the IGL_Renderable object that is drawn by this panel.

Returns:
A reference to the IGL_Renderable that is drawn by this panel.

setCamera

public void setCamera(Camera camera)
Set the camera to be used to determine the observer's point of view and view volume. Note: This method records a reference to the specified camera. Consequently, the same camera could be shared by several JoglPanel objects.

Parameters:
camera - The camera object to use.

getCamera

public Camera getCamera()
Get the camera to be used to determine the observer's point of view and view volume. Note: This method returns a reference to the camera currently used by this panel. The VRP, COP, VUV and view volume can be specifed by getting the camera and using methods on the camera to change the values.

Returns:
a reference to the current camera object in use.

setCurrentViewAsHome

public void setCurrentViewAsHome()
Save the current view information as the "home" view, so that it can be easily reset.

resetToHomeView

public void resetToHomeView()
Copy the "home" view parameters into the current camera. The panel will need to be drawn to make the new values effective.

enableLighting

public void enableLighting(boolean on_off)
Set flag indicating whether or not this panel should enable OpenGL lighting. Lighting is enabled by default.

Parameters:
on_off - Flag indicting whether lighting should be on or off.

enableHeadlight

public void enableHeadlight(boolean on_off)
Set flag indicating whether or not this panel should include a "headlight" that moves with the observer. The headlight is on by default.

Parameters:
on_off - Flag indicting whether the headlight should be on or off.

enableAmbient

public void enableAmbient(boolean on_off)
Set flag indicating whether or not this panel should include a "global" ambient light that applies to the whole scene. The global ambient light is on by default.

Parameters:
on_off - Flag indicting whether the ambient light should be on or off.

setHeadlightColor

public void setHeadlightColor(java.awt.Color color)
Specifiy the color for the headlight.

Parameters:
color - New color to use for the headlight.

setAmbientColor

public void setAmbientColor(java.awt.Color color)
Specifiy the color for the global ambient light.

Parameters:
color - New color to use for the global ambient light.

pickHitList

public HitRecord[] pickHitList(int x,
                               int y)
Get the OpenGL selection hit list for the specified window coordinates x,y. The objects in the list of objects for this panel will be rendered using a special small viewing volume centered around the specified pixel. This should only be called from the event handling thread.

Parameters:
x - The pixel x (i.e. column) value
y - The pixel y (i.e. row) value, in window coordinates.

pickedPoint

public Vector3D pickedPoint(int x,
                            int y)
Get a Vector3D for the point in 3D corresponding to the specified pixel location.

Parameters:
x - The pixel x (i.e. column) value
y - The pixel y (i.e. row) value, in window coordinates.

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
Main program that creates a box centered at the origin and displays it in 3D. NOTE: The observer is at the center of the box.
